result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah M. Ferber

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:46 AM cases 21CF1013, 22CF246 called. Defendant Sarah M. Ferber not in court.  Attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber appeared by video for Sarah M. Ferber.  Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests scheduling a motion hearing. State does not oppose scheduling. State requests 60-90 minutes for the motion hearing. 
9:49 AM Defendant appears telephonically and is given date for the motion hearing. 
A motion hearing is scheduled for 11/14/22 at 1:30 pm (2 hours in person).
Scheduling conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.

(1:59 PM cases 21CF1013, 22CF246 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sarah M. Ferber appeared by video. Attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber appeared by video for Sarah M. Ferber.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Court notes there has been a motion to suppress filed in 21CF1013.
Attorney Weber requests to schedule a motion hearing.
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 21CF1013, 22CF246 and enters Not Guilty pleas, which the Court accepts. 
Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 9:45 am (1/2 hour) via Zoom.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on July 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(1:29 PM cases 21CF1013, 22CF246 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sarah M. Ferber in court. Attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber in court for Sarah M. Ferber.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1013, 22CF246 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Weber to schedule Arraignments with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
